content: Is the obesity rate in India higher than that in Japan?

Yes, the obesity rate in India is higher than that in Japan. According to the World Health Organization (WHO), in 2016, the obesity rate in India was around 3.9%, while in Japan, it was around 3.5%. However, it's important to note that both countries have different definitions and measurements of obesity, and the rates may have changed since then. Additionally, while India has a higher obesity rate, Japan has a higher rate of overweight individuals, with around 38.8% of the population being overweight in 2016, compared to around 20% in India.
